subject: Public Speaking
title: Malcolm X: Moral Clarity
description: A short lesson to help you apply Malcolm X: Moral Clarity.

hook.text: Malcolm X's speeches named oppression directly without softening.

buildup.text: He rejected compromise and demanded justice immediately.

discovery.text: Uncompromising moral clarity can be more persuasive than diplomacy.

twist.text: Some audiences are only moved by truth spoken harshly.

climax.text: Malcolm's speeches pushed the Overton window. Radical became discussable.

punchline.text: Sometimes clarity beats diplomacy. Speak truth.
